definition: strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
to make/to cause/to enable/to use/to employ/to send/to instruct sb to do sth/envoy/messenger

sentences.english: He couldn't bring himself to do it.
The President dictated to them how everything would be done.
sentences.chinese: 总统强使这个法案在国会获得通过。

sentences.english: Children were rent from their mothers'arms by the brutal soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 凶暴的士兵强使孩子离开母亲的怀抱。

sentences.english: Children were rent from their mothers' arms by the brutal soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 凶暴的士兵强使孩子们离开他们母亲的怀抱。

sentences.english: The teacher pounded the grammatical rules into her students.
sentences.chinese: 老师强使学生记住语法规则。

sentences.english: They ramrodded their proposal through the parliament.
sentences.chinese: 他们强使议会通过他们提出的议案。

sentences.english: My impression was that he was having to force himself to talk.
sentences.chinese: 我的印象是，他必须强使我自己说话。

sentences.english: They bulled a bill throught Congress.
sentences.chinese: 他们强使国会通过一项法案。

definition: controlled (by sb)/to suffer under a yoke
to urge (sb to do do sth)/to drive (sb to take an action)
not in such a way as to/not likely to
to persist/to continue upholding/to persevere/to stick to sth/stubborn
to let (sth happen)/to allow (sb to do sth)/to submit to/to yield
to such an extent as to/down to/up to
old variant of 晚近[wan3 jin4]
to put to work (servant or animal)/to make use of for labor
